channel.title: Ban list
channel.description:
mopar, sopposedly( according to the peeps on the irc) when ever someone is banned the forums crash. can you fix this?
or make some 1337 haxes? :P thanks

Mopar, instead of banning, why not just delete the usernames and IP ban them?

item.title: Ban list
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Taharok:

Apparently, but why does SMF need thirteen queries to ban someone anyway. =\

When I think about it, most of those were probably triggered when I viewed other pages instead of the actual banning process.

Mopar, instead of banning, why not just delete the usernames and IP ban them?

item.title: Ban list
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:17, topic:144130”]I meant which form fields. The options.

Do you set an expiration?
Do you put reasons and notes?
Full or partial ban?[/quote]

It doesn’t matter what the options are, even so much as editing a ban (removing triggers, expiring it etc) causes the same effect. It has got to be some super-inefficient SQL query that only has a problem when a large number of ban triggers are in the database.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban list
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I meant which form fields. The options.

Do you set an expiration?
Do you put reasons and notes?
Full or partial ban?

This is a log of all querys that passed through the function db_query as I banned a user:

Query: 
			SELECT variable, value
			FROM smf_settings
Query: 
		SELECT data
		FROM smf_sessions
		WHERE session_id = '9ef9431733e21e0edc27b6f2c21381fb'
		LIMIT 1
Query: 
				SELECT mem.*, IFNULL(a.ID_ATTACH, 0) AS ID_ATTACH, a.filename, a.attachmentType
				FROM smf_members AS mem
					LEFT JOIN smf_attachments AS a ON (a.ID_MEMBER = 1)
				WHERE mem.ID_MEMBER = 1
				LIMIT 1
Query: 
			SELECT variable, value, ID_MEMBER, ID_THEME
			FROM smf_themes
			WHERE ID_MEMBER IN (-1, 0, 1)
				AND ID_THEME = 1
Query: 
				DELETE FROM smf_log_online
				WHERE logTime < NOW() - INTERVAL 900 SECOND
					AND session != '9ef9431733e21e0edc27b6f2c21381fb'
Query: 
			UPDATE smf_log_online
			SET logTime = NOW(), ip = IFNULL(INET_ATON('68.193.15.23'), 0), url = 'a:3:{s:6:\"action\";s:3:\"ban\";s:2:\"sa\";s:4:\"edit\";s:10:\"USER_AGENT\";s:34:\"Opera/9.23 (Windows NT 5.1; U; en)\";}'
			WHERE session = '9ef9431733e21e0edc27b6f2c21381fb'
			LIMIT 1
Query: 
		UPDATE smf_members
		SET
			lastLogin = 1190062210,
			memberIP = 'edited out',
			memberIP2 = 'edited out',
			totalTimeLoggedIn = 43173
		WHERE ID_MEMBER = 1
		LIMIT 1
Query: 
			SELECT ID_BAN_GROUP
			FROM smf_ban_groups
			WHERE name = 'xxlegitxx3'
			LIMIT 1
Query: 
				INSERT INTO smf_ban_groups
					(name, ban_time, expire_time, cannot_access, cannot_register, cannot_post, cannot_login, reason, notes)
				VALUES
					(SUBSTRING('xxlegitxx3', 1, 20), 1190062210, NULL, 1, 0, 0, 0, SUBSTRING('i suck at life', 1, 255), SUBSTRING('he\'s a nub', 1, 65534))
Query: 
		REPLACE INTO smf_settings
			(variable, value)
		VALUES (SUBSTRING('banLastUpdated', 1, 255), SUBSTRING('1190062210', 1, 65534))
Query: 
		SELECT mem.ID_MEMBER, mem.is_activated + 10 AS new_value
		FROM (smf_ban_groups AS bg, smf_ban_items AS bi, smf_members AS mem)
		WHERE bg.ID_BAN_GROUP = bi.ID_BAN_GROUP
			AND bg.cannot_access = 1
			AND (bg.expire_time IS NULL OR bg.expire_time > 1190062210)
			AND (mem.ID_MEMBER = bi.ID_MEMBER OR mem.emailAddress LIKE bi.email_address)
			AND mem.is_activated < 10
Query: 
		SELECT mem.ID_MEMBER, mem.is_activated - 10 AS new_value
		FROM smf_members AS mem
			LEFT JOIN smf_ban_items AS bi ON (bi.ID_MEMBER = mem.ID_MEMBER OR mem.emailAddress LIKE bi.email_address)
			LEFT JOIN smf_ban_groups AS bg ON (bg.ID_BAN_GROUP = bi.ID_BAN_GROUP AND bg.cannot_access = 1 AND (bg.expire_time IS NULL OR bg.expire_time > 1190062210))
		WHERE (bi.ID_BAN IS NULL OR bg.ID_BAN_GROUP IS NULL)
			AND mem.is_activated >= 10
Query: 
			SELECT
				bi.ID_BAN, bi.hostname, bi.email_address, bi.ID_MEMBER, bi.hits,
				bi.ip_low1, bi.ip_high1, bi.ip_low2, bi.ip_high2, bi.ip_low3, bi.ip_high3, bi.ip_low4, bi.ip_high4,
				bg.ID_BAN_GROUP, bg.name, bg.ban_time, bg.expire_time, bg.reason, bg.notes, bg.cannot_access, bg.cannot_register, bg.cannot_login, bg.cannot_post,
				IFNULL(mem.ID_MEMBER, 0) AS ID_MEMBER, mem.memberName, mem.realName
			FROM smf_ban_groups AS bg
				LEFT JOIN smf_ban_items AS bi ON (bi.ID_BAN_GROUP = bg.ID_BAN_GROUP)
				LEFT JOIN smf_members AS mem ON (mem.ID_MEMBER = bi.ID_MEMBER)
			WHERE bg.ID_BAN_GROUP = 2
Query: 
		UPDATE smf_sessions
		SET data = 'rand_code|s:32:\"1d36869c53010e137c4976f74ab84c85\";ID_MSG_LAST_VISIT|s:3:\"145\";log_time|i:1190062210;timeOnlineUpdated|i:1190062210;unread_messages|i:0;old_url|s:54:\"http://forums.qknotes.com/index.php?action=ban;sa=edit\";USER_AGENT|s:34:\"Opera/9.23 (Windows NT 5.1; U; en)\";admin_time|i:1190061419;', last_update = 1190062210
		WHERE session_id = '9ef9431733e21e0edc27b6f2c21381fb'
		LIMIT 1

It is way too convoluted for me to draw an opinion, but it’s 13 queries.
And it’s run through this query function:

function db_query($db_string, $file, $line)
{
	
	global $db_cache, $db_count, $db_connection, $db_show_debug, $modSettings;
	
	// One more query....
	$db_count = !isset($db_count) ? 1 : $db_count + 1;

	// Debugging.
	if (isset($db_show_debug) && $db_show_debug === true)
	{
		// Initialize $db_cache if not already initialized.
		if (!isset($db_cache))
			$db_cache = array();

		if (!empty($_SESSION['debug_redirect']))
		{
			$db_cache = array_merge($_SESSION['debug_redirect'], $db_cache);
			$db_count = count($db_cache) + 1;
			$_SESSION['debug_redirect'] = array();
		}

		$db_cache[$db_count]['q'] = $db_string;
		$db_cache[$db_count]['f'] = $file;
		$db_cache[$db_count]['l'] = $line;
		$st = microtime();
	}

	// First, we clean strings out of the query, reduce whitespace, lowercase, and trim - so we can check it over.
	if (empty($modSettings['disableQueryCheck']))
	{
		$clean = '';
		$old_pos = 0;
		$pos = -1;
		while (true)
		{
			$pos = strpos($db_string, '\'', $pos + 1);
			if ($pos === false)
				break;
			$clean .= substr($db_string, $old_pos, $pos - $old_pos);

			while (true)
			{
				$pos1 = strpos($db_string, '\'', $pos + 1);
				$pos2 = strpos($db_string, '\\', $pos + 1);
				if ($pos1 === false)
					break;
				elseif ($pos2 == false || $pos2 > $pos1)
				{
					$pos = $pos1;
					break;
				}

				$pos = $pos2 + 1;
			}
			$clean .= '%s';

			$old_pos = $pos + 1;
		}
		$clean .= substr($db_string, $old_pos);
		$clean = trim(strtolower(preg_replace(array('~\s+~s', '~/\*!40001 SQL_NO_CACHE \*/~', '~/\*!40000 USE INDEX \([A-Za-z\_]+?\) \*/~'), array(' ', '', ''), $clean)));

		// We don't use UNION in SMF, at least so far.  But it's useful for injections.
		if (strpos($clean, 'union') !== false && preg_match('~(^|[^a-z])union($|[^[a-z])~s', $clean) != 0)
			$fail = true;
		// Comments?  We don't use comments in our queries, we leave 'em outside!
		elseif (strpos($clean, '/*') > 2 || strpos($clean, '--') !== false || strpos($clean, ';') !== false)
			$fail = true;
		// Trying to change passwords, slow us down, or something?
		elseif (strpos($clean, 'set password') !== false && preg_match('~(^|[^a-z])set password($|[^[a-z])~s', $clean) != 0)
			$fail = true;
		elseif (strpos($clean, 'benchmark') !== false && preg_match('~(^|[^a-z])benchmark($|[^[a-z])~s', $clean) != 0)
			$fail = true;
		// Sub selects?  We don't use those either.
		elseif (preg_match('~\([^)]*?select~s', $clean) != 0)
			$fail = true;

		if (!empty($fail))
		{
			log_error('Hacking attempt...' . "\n" . $db_string, $file, $line);
			fatal_error('Hacking attempt...', false);
		}
	}

	$ret = mysql_query($db_string, $db_connection);
	if ($ret === false && $file !== false)
		$ret = db_error($db_string, $file, $line);

	// Debugging.
	if (isset($db_show_debug) && $db_show_debug === true)
		$db_cache[$db_count]['t'] = array_sum(explode(' ', microtime())) - array_sum(explode(' ', $st));

	return $ret;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Ban list
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I won’t switch from SMF, I love the structure and I have yet to see a forum software (free or otherwise) that beats it.

In response to sppt and xxlegitxx, I have not modified the banning system at all, so all source code in the downloadable SMF installation is the same as what I have. I can tell you that deleting most of the triggers speeds things up tremendously. In fact that is how I have improved it in the past, dumping all of the permanent IP ban triggers to a shell script that blocks them with iptables, then deleting the records from the database.

Read full topic
